page.title: 02Eccles Journal Newspaper 1
page.content: The Eccles Journal was established in 1874. The owner was called Tillotson. Since then it has been taken over twice and is now owned by N.C.N. of Bolton. It was first situated beside the Bulls Head in Church St. In 1927 it moved to its present address. It employs 3 reporters and advert staff and 2 counter staff in the Eccles office. It costs 62p for four lines in a small advertisement and 22 pounds for an advert up to 8 by 8 cm. A full page advert cost 360 pounds. This gives the Journal about 5,000 pounds a week. The Journal is printed in Bolton every Tuesday.It is printed using the following method. Each piece is photographed onto sticky backed paper. This is arranged to make the page, then put on to a metal plate for printing.
